sn7.16:1.2: Now on that occasion a brahmin named Paccanīkasāta, Relisher of Contradiction, was residing at Sāvatthī.
sn7.16:1.3: Then it occurred to the brahmin Paccanīkasāta:
sn7.16:1.6: Now on that occasion the Blessed One was walking back and forth in the open.
sn7.16:1.7: Then the brahmin Paccanīkasāta approached the Blessed One and said to him while he was walking back and forth:
sn7.16:2.3: By one with a corrupt mind
sn7.16:3.2: And the distrust of one’s heart,
sn7.16:3.3: If one has cast away aversion,
sn7.16:4.1: When this was said, the brahmin Paccanīkasāta said to the Blessed One:
sn7.16:4.3: Let Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who from today has gone for refuge for life.
